pkgmetadata.longdescription: pyramid-is-live===============.. image:: https://travis-ci.com/GoodRx/pyramid-is-live.svg :target: https://travis-ci.com/GoodRx/pyramid-is-live``pyramid-is-live`` uses a tween to add an ``is_live`` property to Pyramidrequests, which is ``True`` if the request came from a HTTP interaction and``False`` otherwise, e.g. if the request came from ``pyramid.paster.bootstrap``.Getting Started---------------1. Install this package:: pip install pyramid-is-live2. Include it in your application startup: .. code-block:: python def main(global_config, **settings): config = Configurator(...) config.include("pyramid_is_live") ...3. Use ``request.is_live`` in your views and scripts!Contributing------------We use `tox <https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/>`_ to run our tests andlinters.Run ``tox`` to run all tests and linters.Run ``tox -e format`` to reformat your code using `Black<https://black.readthedocs.io/en/stable/>`_ and `isort<https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort>`_.
